Articles.Content:
Hello fellow Kerbonauts!

I have been playing KSP for roughly a month now and just wanted to introduce myself! Even though IÃ‚Â´m approaching 40 years I feel again like a small boy while playing KSP. No other game has given me that feeling. Awesome!

Just a short summary of my accomplishments and completed missions in KSP:

- Unmanned sub-orbital

- Manned sub-orbital

- Unmanned orbital

- Manned orbital

- Unmanned orbital docking ( Construction of my first space-station Kerlab 2)

- Manned orbital docking ( First Kerlab 2 crew, Jeb, Bill and Bob)

- Munar probe landing

- Unmanned munar orbit with docking ( Construction of Munar space-station Titan A 1)

- Dunar orbital probe

My next mission will be an unmanned lunar landing and return. I want to test all of my designs on several unmanned missions before I try manned (kerballed) ones. I just love this game!

Regards,

Badan

Great! You can upload screenshots (pressing F1 you take a screenshot) to image shering sites such as imgr.com and embed them in the forum so we can see them!

Good schedule, do you use any mods?

Hi!

I have taken some screenshots, IÃ‚Â´ll post them on the forum. I have downloaded some rocket parts and mechjeb but I use only vanilla parts and also like to fly without mechjeb.

Hi!

I have taken some screenshots, IÃ‚Â´ll post them on the forum. I have downloaded some rocket parts and mechjeb but I use only vanilla parts and also like to fly without mechjeb.

Good, i dont like mechjeb either, havent even downloaded it!

im a purist haha

I'll admit it, I've used mechjeb. I'll turn it on and watch what it does and then try to repeat it. My powered landings still stink, but my orbital operations have greatly improved.

It's good you are taking this step-wise. Makes each achievement seem grand.

You did a manned docking? You are already a ksp-pro!

Anyway, welcome to the forums!

Hi again and thanks for your welcoming messages!

I will propably test mechjeb in some distant future but at the moment I just love to fly manually. I have docked about ten times now and I find it extremely rewarding! My first docking took around three to four hours to complete. It is just an amazing feeling seeing the target spacecraft just floating a couple of meters in front of you while both ships are actually zipping around faster than a bullet.

Welcome to the community Badan100

Good luck with the probe missions to the Mun, it'll be even more fun with Kerbals though, as you can then go EVA and wander around
